tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE compliance_training_records (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name VARCHAR(255),
    training_topic VARCHAR(255),
    completion_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE compliance_training_records (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  training_title TEXT NOT NULL,
  completion_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name TEXT NOT NULL,
  department TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE compliance_training_records (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  training_type VARCHAR(255),
  completion_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(255),
  department VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE regulatory_adherence (
  record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT,
  training_type VARCHAR(255),
  adherence_status BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE compliance_training_records (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    training_name VARCHAR(50),
    completion_date DATE,
    completion_status VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(50),
    role VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE training_courses (
    course_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    course_name VARCHAR(50),
    required_duration INT,
    course_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE training_progress (
    employee_id INT,
    course_id INT,
    start_date DATE,
    completion_date DATE,
    progress_percentage INT
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    department VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE training_courses (
    course_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    course_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    duration INT,
    pass_percentage INT
);

CREATE TABLE employee_training (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    course_id INT,
    date_enrolled TIMESTAMP,
    completion_date TIMESTAMP,
    score FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (course_id) REFERENCES training_courses(course_id)
);

CREATE TABLE training_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    course_id INT,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    instructor VARCHAR(100),
    FOREIGN KEY (course_id) REFERENCES training_courses(course_id)
);

CREATE TABLE compliance_reports (
    report_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    report_date DATE,
    compliance_status BOOLEAN,
    remarks TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
);
